page.title: 15THE SCHOOL IN AMBASTON LANE
page.content: Along the A6 on the corner of London Road and Ambaston Lane is a small three classroomed school with 59 children and three full-time teachers. Their names are Mr. Heath, Mrs. Mitchell, Mrs. Scholes and one part time teacher named Mrs. Eno. It is a very pleasant village school. The school was founded in 1810 with money raised from local subsciption. In 1847 the school was rebuilt to give more spacious accommodation for the teacher and the pupils. The leaded windows of this time can still be seen and are an attractive feature of the school. The school has a board of governors. Also there is the School Friends, a parents- teacher organisation. We asked class 2 what they thought of the school. They decided
